channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Abandoned furniture, please remove, 19th January
item.description:
There are 4 white chairs abandoned on the street on Goulton Rd (around 2b). Please remove. (There are frequently abandoned furniture around there, left on the street for weeks at a time, each occasion being an absolute eye-sore for residents)

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Goulton Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: So much litter on Goulton Road and Clarence road, 19th January
item.description:
There is a bin that is overflowing and hasn't been collected for over a week. It's disgusting..a public health & safety hazard. Generally, there is so much free flowing trash on Goulton Rd. & Clarence Rd. it's truly a disgrace. Please clean up the streets!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Athlone Close, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Private owner not using bins provided, 19th January
item.description:
For many months this private company running the site has refused to manage their waste. They now appear to have vacated the site leaving empty Southwark council provided rubbish bins but rubbish is accumulating all around the bins and has done for weeks. It is now getting worse with other people leaving their rubbish there also. The name of the company that had been using the property is backyard cinema and the magicians table.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 47-49, Tanner Street, Old Kent Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lets the dogs poo every where, 19th January
item.description:
The dog owner never picks up poo. Lives it there. He has been. Doing so since he moved in. Let's the dogs poo every where. He does not clean it
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Shacklewell Row, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hole in the road., 19th January
item.description:
Potholes in the junction was “repaired” a few weeks and, sure enough, they’re back again just like they were before. Very deep and dangerous for motorbikes and cyclists. Needs properly patching.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Plumstead High Street, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Moatfield, Christchurch Avenue NW6 7PD, 19th January
item.description:
I am writing to report a dangerous uncovered manhole located at the entrance of Moatfield, Christchurch Avenue NW6 7PD. This manhole has been uncovered for over a year now and has been a serious risk to all the residents living here, including many children who live and walk past it daily. On December 30th while walking past it I slipped and my leg got stuck in the hole. Since then I have been in and out of hospitals with an infection, constant pain, struggling to walk and this has lead to me being unable to work. I would like this issue to be addressed as soon as possible to reduce the risk of further injuries and accidents.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Christchurch Avenue, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Next to bin shed on pathway, 19th January
item.description:
It’s been like this for about two weeks now the rubbish is on the pathway which also causes a problem for my daughter to walk past every day to go get on her minibus for school there’s no other safe up pathway for her to use she has got mobility issues she walks past this rubbish every day with her walker she sometimes gets caught on the rubbish is a health and safety hazard it needs to be cleared away for people not to leave their rubbish there needs to be dealt with as soon as possible.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Sten Close, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
